meanings.sent1: She overcounted the candies and ended up with too many.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overcount the money in his wallet.
meanings.sent3: The child overcounted the toys and thought he had a hundred.
meanings.sent4: I overcounted the steps to the top of the hill, feeling exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The baker overcounted the eggs, resulting in a cake that was too dense.

meanings.definition: To have counted more than the actual number.
meanings.sent1: They realized they had overcounted the chairs for the event.
meanings.sent2: She often overcounted the pages in her favorite book.
meanings.sent3: The robot overcounted the tasks and got confused.
meanings.sent4: The detective overcounted the suspects, missing the real culprit.
meanings.sent5: The astronomer overcounted the stars in the sky, amazed by their beauty.
